p: As it is shown in Table 4, the anti-ROS ability has been mainly investigated in PlL extracts. Scientifically, this ability has been addressed to the richness in polyphenols the extracts possess, which not only inhibits the production of ROS by the direct involvement of specific molecules [ 99], but also can modulate the Keap1-Nrf2/ARE pathway [ 100]. This is a powerful oxidation-reduction defense system, where polyphenols act to degrade specifically the Keap1 protein and regulate the Nrf2-related pathway [ 59, 101].
